instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.SMC_TPAD_RST_L: What is SMC_TPAD_RST_L? SMC_TPAD_RST_L is a signal that comes from the trackpad that can reset the SMC when it is low.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v. The trackpad having corrosion from liquid damage is a very common cause of no light on the magsafe charger & the system not turning on, when the trackpad or trackpad cable is corroded and holding this line down. .

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .....<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A......Not turn on with pwr btn(system start automatically)
threads.message:
hi...
i have a macbook pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>..the part no is <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a....the problm is not turn with power btn
but iam sure the pwr btn is working...because when the system is turn automatically...also loading mac os...that time all keys in keyboards are working
i also trying to long press pwr btn ..that time the sytem is turned off..so btn is ok....so what next...

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .....<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A......Not turn on with pwr btn(system start automatically)
threads.message:
in keyboard pin no 5 get 3.42 v
also i trying to short <RESISTOR>R5116</RESISTOR> PAD..same condition....when the system make shutdown then not turn

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .....<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A......Not turn on with pwr btn(system start automatically)
threads.message:
Do you get 3V at <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>?
If not check, <RESISTOR>R5170</RESISTOR>.
If good, then disconnect keyboard and test again.

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .....<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A......Not turn on with pwr btn(system start automatically)
threads.message:
Yes ..get 3.42 v on <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>
<RESISTOR>R5170</RESISTOR> Also get 3.42v(value also showing 10k)
i try without keyboard also..still same....what next

threads.title: MACBOOK PRO <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> .....<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A......Not turn on with pwr btn(system start automatically)
threads.message:
Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> (at same time).
Use <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads, instead of power button.
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_TPAD_RST_L</SIGNAL> level.
Also check all PCH's RTC signals.
